oai_dc:dc.dc:title: OSCILLATORY FLOW AND SEDIMENT MOTION OVER A RIPPLED BED
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Blondeaux, Paolo
Vittori, Giovanna
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: rippled bed
oscillatory flow
sediment transport
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Experimental visualizations have been performed of the oscillatory flow and of the sediment motion produced by a sea wave propagating over a rippled bed. In particular the dynamics of the vortex structures generated by flow separation at the ripple crest is investigated along with the mechanism through which sediments are lifted up from the bed and carried in suspension. A numerical model is formulated and the results obtained are successfully compared with the experimental data.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
